meanings.definition: A wasting or consumptive disease, especially pulmonary tuberculosis.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with phthisis after seeing the X-ray of their lungs.
meanings.sent2: Phthisis was a common cause of death in the 19th century before the discovery of antibiotics.
meanings.sent3: Despite his phthisis, the patient always had a positive attitude and made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The phthisis of poverty slowly eats away at the fabric of society.
meanings.sent5: The image of the phthisis-ridden lungs haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: A progressive wasting away of the body.
meanings.sent1: The elderly man's phthisis was evident in his frail frame and sunken cheeks.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the disease caused a gradual phthisis of the muscles, leaving him weak and exhausted.
meanings.sent3: Despite his phthisis, he never lost his sense of humor and always made others laugh.
meanings.sent4: The phthisis of neglect slowly eroded the once vibrant community.
meanings.sent5: The relentless phthisis of time eventually catches up with us all.
